intro: Meconopsis ganeshensis, commonly known as the Ganesh Himal meconopsis, is a rare alpine plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or mountainous regions. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a hairy texture adapted to the cold climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
